page.title: 05"MY CHILDHOOD IN ST.IVES."
page.content:
An excerpt from an{interview}with an old St.Ives resident.
"As a child I lived on the{Island,}in the house which was then called "The Battery" because of the First World War gun emplacements outside.It had a large kitchen and two bedrooms,all on one floor with very high ceilings.We had no electric or gas and cooked on a big Valor paraffin stove.We used paraffin lamps and we also had a large Cornish range for heating and cooking. My mother ironed with an iron heated on the stove. My father worked in Penlee Quarry, Newlyn.He walked or cycled to work.He was also unemployed for short periods. He then worked as a shotfirer when they blasted down through the Warren to put the new sewers in."
